caption: I went here for a taro milk tea and I give it a 0 out of 5. The taro at Mr. Lins is watery and just purple in color. After I received my tea and tasted it it was extremely watery and had zerooo flavor. I was told that it had green tea in it as the base after complaining (when the menu clearly says milk tea) . Once I told the cashier I didn’t want the purple water. I was told there was nothing that can be done. After speaking to everyone in this booth and repeating the beverage was grosss. We were then  able to exchange and get passion fruit tea with bubble and it was extremely sweet. In conclusion , if you want the worst bubble tea go to Mr.Lin.
No frills, small family run restaurant. Lo Mein is my go to dish and is always tasty. The menu (and portion size) is substantial and everything is super cheap.

I LOVEEEE their food. I used to go before work and get a meal. The duck over rice is so good. There dumplings are my absolute favorite. A little bit pricey, but I wouldn’t mind treating myself once and a while

One of the best watermelon slushies that has never given me brain freeze. It tastes like a blended fresh watermelon with ice. And is consistently good each time I order. I recommend trying it if you love the taste of water melon.
Best food ever
I love rice noodle soup here and the service is pretty great.
Ordered delivery. Waited 2 hours and then got a notification that they cancelled my order. Terrible.

I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the team is welcoming and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we enjoy a pleasant evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

Average fishball soup. The soup itself tastes good but suspect it was because of MSG(Monosodium Glutamate), not because of natural ingredients. Fishballs are soft and not that flavorful. Overall it's too pricey though understandable because of the location. Would suggest review the cost structure and go for more high-end premium cuisine selection to ensure price-quality fit.
Intensely mediocre.
Amazing food, I eat here everyday, three times a day.

wow，can’t believe I paid $12 for this 4 pieces of chicken. Sooooo overpriced. —————- Update after I ate: Wow, I also order two side of duck, and they use chicken to substitute duck. Change 2 stars to 1. What a shame to Asian food
Best fish ball soup in NYC. The tea eggs are so tasty. This place is authentic and unlike any other vendor in DeKalb Market. 100% Mr Lin! 💯
I had the wonton soup and duck over rice. the wontons are home made and filling. The meat had a lot of flavor and everything together was really good. Good customer service, coming back soon
fast service and good food. mostly recommend spicy noodle soups

I didn't read reviews and learned the hard way. The food is not made to order, they only reheat it (aka microwave). I paid $13 for 4-5 pieces of pork and 2-3 pieces of broccoli. In terms of flavor, you get two options: salty or bland. Don't waste your time here. Go to The Wei (one block away) and get better portions and taste. I got a good feeling this place won't last if they don't adjust their food accordingly.
Microwaved food, small portions (mostly noodles), expensive and just not very good food.  Won't go back

I ordered duck over rice, it’s around 13 dollars, but they only placed three small pieces duck meat with bone in the box. The other just rice and broccoli. And the sauce is too salty. Quite disappointed, hope they can improve this
I was looking forward to another Chinese option in the neighborhood. This isn't it. Food is microwaved, plated with almost no sauce and a tiny portion for way too high a price. Go anywhere else.
Total joke-  using branding to seem elevated and it’s awful food- microwaved
4.30.18 - not open yet, but I will return to review after it does.
